channel.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
channel.description:
Hey guys just wanted a discussion (not a flame session),
Whats your opinion on drugs and why?
What is your favorite drug/most despised drug?
Lets kick start with my opinion :).
Drugs in a safe environment that do not cause extreme harmful effects should be legal rather than people wondering around the streets high of there faces which potentionaly may cause harm to themselves/others or vandalism etc. Many people cannot go to there home to have a kick. Drug abuse cannot be stopped completely so people should at least make it more safe should they not?
My personal favorite drug is Mdai. It has the high of mdma without the euphoria (unless with alcohol in my opinion) but without the comedown. It is mdma with a different structural forumula and is legal (in britain at least) for research purposes. Why do I like this? Because its cheap, nice and fairly safe.

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Sapphire, to me (I’m 16 however) 4-6 j’s a day all the time is a lot o.O. But nicenice.

Read full topic

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Quitting pot is super easy if you’re busy or have something to do, since you were probably smoking it out of boredom anyways.

If I wanted to take some time off, it would be hard because i’m just sitting around doing nothing anyways. But if I were to visit reletives far away for a few weeks, it wouldn’t even cross my mind once. weed has some addictive aspects to it. By nature I think anything that is fun and easily repeatable is going to be addictive. But to me it’s just as easy to put the joint down as it is the game controller for a favorite addictive game.

Quitting tobacco and coffee on the other hand… what a depressing thought. That will be hell and I know I have to do it soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Davidi2:

And what impression would that be? Surely if you don’t think doing drugs is bad, it wouldn’t be a bad impression?

I don’t think cannabis should be classed as an illegal drug, I have nothing against people who take drugs although I do think people need to learn how to control their drug abuse, otherwise just face death. What I meant by early impression is by me giving up drugs my child won’t be around that environment, giving it more motivation in life rather than “My dad smokes pot”.

Heroin and crack are the only drugs I haven’t taken, and I am totally against taking them as I’ve seen it destroy lives so quickly.

Read full topic

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

And what impression would that be? Surely if you don’t think doing drugs is bad, it wouldn’t be a bad impression?

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I wasn’t spending much money on it, I know a lot of others that smoke it and grow it so I often had it free. I wouldn’t smoke normal cigarettes only spliffs, I’ve been smoking it for about four years and would average 4 - 6 a day.

I did not get addicted once, the only reason why I quit is because my partner is due to give birth to my son in 4 months so best make a early impression.

Read full topic

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:104, topic:405858”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=502847.msg3702061#msg3702061 date=1312809335]

I’m on day 3 of quitting my cannabis use, I don’t feel the ‘need’ to smoke a spliff, although I am missing it a lot.
[/quote]Good for you

OT - You only live once, that’s exactly right.

So why spend it messing with your brain, wasting money, and wasting time. I’ve never seen how it could be worth it, which is why I’ve never done drugs

I didn’t see my drug use a problem, nor did I find it had any effect on my every day life. In fact, I was more creative when I smoked cannabis.[/quote]How often did you do it? Obviously there is a very big difference between people that are addicted and people that do it ‘sometimes’ just for the feeling. (if you could quit this easily I don’t think you were addicted ) Either way, how much did you spend on it? Now you can spend that money on anything you want (Which will probably last longer than a high)

Read full topic

Lol it was an example I’m 15 and have no intention of begetting an offspring for quite some time.
[/quote]
You wont get any with your attitude for a while anyways, because you dislike something you instantly want to troll it. Your not gonna get far with women with those epic0rz troll skills :([/quote]

item.title: Narcotic (drug abuse) discussion
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:88, topic:405858”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=502847.msg3694024#msg3694024 date=1312316440]

Yeah, if you have the slightest bit of self control, then it is your decision. I hate people that blame everything on other people. Someone else “influenced me”. Well it would be your own damn fault for letting them do that.

So what you’re saying is, if my son overdoses on drugs I should just go on with life because it would be my fault if he influences me.

If your son dies its his fault. Same thing if someone joins the army…, they joined the army to go fight ‘for there country’ (…not for money and the experiance or whatever clearly…) is there own fault. Them dying or killings others or w.e. influences people, few think wrong of it.

And what if the son decides to start doing drugs because he was never told by his parents that they were bad? What if it was a result if peer pressure, and he was never taught how to handle it? Just saying something is someone’s fault doesn’t mean it didn’t happen. The son still died - I am still affected.
[/quote]
What if my mother told me knife’s aren’t dangerous when I was young, do you think I’d go stab myself? Your grasping at straws…[/quote]
No I’m not they’re not related, knives are very obviously dangerous and you encounter them in your daily activities hence why you know it’s sharp and can hurt. You don’t go through drugs every day though.
You’re grasping at straws…

Read full topic
